Communications (IEEE TrustCom-15)<br><br>http://comnet.aalto.fi/Trustcom2015/<br><br>20-22 August 2015, Helsinki, Finland<br><br>Latest news:<br>6 Keynotes, 7 workshops and 1 tutorial announced<br><br>Important Dates<br><br>Workshop Proposal: February 1, 2015<br><br>Submission Deadline: 11:59PM (UTC/GMT+3 hours) March 31, 2015<br><br>Authors Notification: May 31, 2015<br><br>Final Manuscript Due: July 1, 2015<br><br>With the rapid development and increasing complexity of computer systems<br>and communication networks, user requirements for trust, security and<br>privacy are becoming more and more demanding. Therefore, there is a grand<br>challenge that traditional security technologies and measures may not meet<br>user [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T18:14:10+11:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>NetSecurity call for paper</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;471d4fdb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;79b8c9a1.1503">   <title>DHL ONLINE SHIPPING PREALERT ADVISORY </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;79b8c9a1.1503</link>   <description> DHL EXPRESS SHIPMENT ADVISORY<br><br>The following 1 piece(s) have been sent by a Customer via DHL Express<br>on 19-02-2014 via AWB# 96 0127 8831<br>Find attached Scanned copy of the Docs and more informations<br>about the parcel<br><br>If you wish to track this(these) shipment(s) please contact your local<br>DHL customer service office or visit the DHL Web Site at<br>http://www.dhl.com<br>If you have a Web-enabled mail reader, click the link below to view<br>shipment tracking<br>details:<br>http://www.dhl.com/en/express/tracking.html?AWB=9601278831&amp;brand=DHL [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T08:21:39+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>DHL EXPRESS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;79b8c9a1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;3ff1b67f.1503">   <title><No subject> </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;3ff1b67f.1503</link>   <description> Attn; Do you need a guaranteed loan of 3% interest Loan to pay your debts or bills or for business purpose? rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8405a235.1503">   <title>[fm-announcements] Fifth Summer School on Formal Techniques, CA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8405a235.1503</link>   <description> Fifth Summer School on Formal Techniques, May 17 - May 22, 2015, Atherton, California<br>http://fm.csl.sri.com/SSFT15<br><br>Techniques based on formal logic, such as model checking, satisfiability, static<br>analysis, and automated theorem proving, are finding a broad range of applications<br>in modeling, analysis, verification, and synthesis. This school, the fifth in the<br>series, will focus on the principles and practice of formal techniques, with a<br>strong emphasis on the hands-on use and development of this technology. It<br>primarily targets graduate students and young researchers who are interested in<br>studying and using formal techniques in their research. A prior background in<br>formal methods [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T16:41:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rungta, Neha S. (ARC-TI)[SGT, INC]</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8405a235.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8bda5fae.1503">   <title>IEEE WoWMoM 2015 Workshop on Autonomic and Opportunistic Communications (AOC) - DEADLINE EXTENDED </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8bda5fae.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8bda5fae.1503">IEEE WoWMoM 2015 Workshop on Autonomic and Opportunistic Communications (AOC) - DEADLINE EXTENDED </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T16:34:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Elisabetta Biondi</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8bda5fae.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;511d1f5.1503">   <title>IEEE ISPA-15 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;511d1f5.1503</link>   <description> The 13th IEEE International Symposium on Parallel and Distributed<br>Processing with Applications (IEEE ISPA-15)<br><br>http://comnet.aalto.fi/ISPA2015/<br><br>20-22 August 2015, Helsinki, Finland<br><br>Latest news:<br>6 Keynotes and 2 workshops announced<br><br>Important Dates<br><br>Workshop Proposal: February 1, 2015<br><br>Submission Deadline: 11:59PM (UTC/GMT+3 hours) March 31, 2015<br><br>Authors Notification: May 31, 2015<br><br>Final Manuscript Due: July 1, 2015<br><br>ISPA-15 (13th IEEE International Symposium on Parallel and Distributed<br>Processing with Applications) is a forum for presenting leading work on<br>parallel and distributed computing and networking, including architecture,<br>compilers, runtime systems, applications, reliability, security, parallel<br>programming models and much more. During the symposium, scientists and<br>engineers [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T18:16:22+11:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>call.for.paper.1987</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;511d1f5.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2e85ad69.1503">   <title>CDVE2015 full paper deadline is coming! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2e85ad69.1503</link>   <description> The 12th International Conference on Cooperative Design, Visualization and<br>Engineering - CDVE2015 will be held on Sept. 20 - Sept. 23, 2015, Mallorca,<br>Spain.<br><br>You are invited to submit a paper and join us. Please see the call for<br>papers &lt;http://www.cdve.org/cfpaper.html&gt; for the call for paper topics. All<br>the accepted papers (full and short) will be published in the proceedings<br>by Springer Verlag on their Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS).<br>Selected best papers will have the chance to publish in certain SCI indexed<br>journals. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T13:51:59-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>cdve 1</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2e85ad69.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;a476ee4d.1503">   <title>MDM 2015 Travel Grant </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;a476ee4d.1503</link>   <description> THE 16TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MOBILE DATA MANAGEMENT (IEEE MDM 2015)<br><br>STUDENT TRAVEL GRANTS<br>(http://mdmconferences.org/mdm2015/student_travel_grant.html)<br><br>The IEEE MDM 2015 conference (http://mdmconferences.org/mdm2015/) is pleased to announce the availability of student travel grants from the<br>U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) for U.S.-based students. Each travel grant will cover up to $1,000 USD towards conference-travel<br>related costs. The amount of support provided to each student is to cover the student's conference registration fee (early registration only),<br>economy airfare from a U.S. carrier, and logging for up to four nights (June 15, 2015 to June 18, 2015). Recipients of the grants will be<br>reimbursed [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:59:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chellappan, Sriram</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;a476ee4d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;98dac13c.1503">   <title>Horn Clauses for Verification and Synthesis - Call for Papers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;98dac13c.1503</link>   <description> Call for Papers<br><br>Horn Clauses for Verification and Synthesis (HCVS)<br><br>July 19, 2015 - San Francisco, USA<br><br>Submission deadlines:<br><br>- paper submission: May 22, 2015<br>- paper notification: June 19, 2015<br><br>Most Program Verification and Synthesis problems of interest can be<br>modeled directly using Horn clauses and many recent advances in the<br>CLP and CAV communities have centered around efficiently solving<br>problems presented as Horn clauses. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:10:23-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Geoff Sutcliffe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;98dac13c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;b9d00a6d.1503">   <title>hey cabernet-events </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;b9d00a6d.1503</link>   <description> Hello! This is me, Olga, from Moscow! Remembered me?<br><br>How are you? Still got no message from you! I miss you actually! When we willgo out for a date?<br><br>I'll be waiting for your suggestions and I hope that ourmeeting will    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T07:45:02-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dixie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;b9d00a6d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;f850bb78.1503">   <title>Summer Offer </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;f850bb78.1503</link>   <description> Please find attached a copy of the Summer Offer sheet which we've extended to the end of march! Call for Papers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;f0721376.1503</link>   <description> iPRA 2015 - THIRD WORKSHOP ON INTERPOLATION: FROM PROOFS TO APPLICATIONS<br><br>CALL FOR CONTRIBUTIONS<br><br>Date: July 18, 2015<br>Location: San Francisco, CA (co-located with CAV 2015)<br>Web: http://forsyte.at/interpolation/<br><br>IMPORTANT DATES<br><br>Submission deadline: May 7, 2015, AOE<br>Notification: May 14, 2015<br>Workshop: July 18, 2015<br><br>ORGANISATION AND COMMITTEE<br><br>Laura Kovacs and Georg Weissenbacher<br><br>SCOPE<br><br>Craig interpolation enjoys a continuing popularity in the field of<br>verification. Historically, Craig's interpolation theorem has received<br>ample attention in proof theory and mathematical logic as well as in<br>complexity theory. The aim of the workshop is to bring together<br>theoreticians and practitioners from different fields. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T13:15:30-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Geoff Sutcliffe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;f0721376.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;caa437d3.1503">   <title>SCART 2015 - 1st Call for Papers (at SEFM 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;caa437d3.1503</link>   <description> [Apologies for multiple postings]<br><br>-- First Call for Papers --<br><br>SCART 2015: 1st International Workshop on the ART of Software Composition, co-located with SEFM 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd York, UK.<br><br>SCART 2015 ( http://scart2015.disim.univaq.it/ ) provides the opportunity for discussing how the FI affects the traditional SE methods and tools, and how facing its complexity in terms of scalability, heterogeneity, and dinamicity promotes the integration of FM within SE practices. We seek answers on how the rigorousness of FM assists software engineers while designing, developing, validating and operating software systems for the FI, which are build via correct-by-construction service composition. The workshop [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T19:12:26+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alexander Perucci</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;caa437d3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2b1ae496.1503">   <title>IEEE MDM 2015 - Student Travel Grants </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2b1ae496.1503</link>   <description> (Our apologies if you received this message multiple times)<br><br>THE 16TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MOBILE DATA MANAGEMENT (IEEE MDM 2015)<br>STUDENT TRAVEL GRANTS<br>(http://mdmconferences.org/mdm2015/student_travel_grant.html)<br><br>The IEEE MDM 2015 conference (http://mdmconferences.org/mdm2015/) is<br>pleased to announce the availability of student travel grants from the U.S.<br>National Science Foundation (NSF) for U.S.-based students. Each travel<br>grant will cover up to $1,000 USD towards conference-travel related costs.<br>The amount of support provided to each student is to cover the student\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds<br>conference registration fee (early registration only), economy airfare<br>from a U.S. carrier, and logging for up to four nights (June 15, 2015 to<br>June [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T09:35:11-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Konstantinos Pelechrinis</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;2b1ae496.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;98e791.1503">   <title>BBB SBQ Form #8634(Ref#69-081-0-4) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;98e791.1503</link>   <description> Thank you for supporting your Better Business Bureau (BBB).<br><br>As a service to BBB Accredited Businesses, we try to ensure that the<br>information we provide to potential customers is as accurate as<br>possible. Tutorial Track Deadline Extended & CFP for Poster and Demo tracks </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8944f66b.1503</link>   <description> Dear all:<br><br>The DEBS 2015 Tutorial Track deadline has been extended by ONE WEEK.<br>The new submission deadline for the Tutorial Track is: March 14, 2015 (AoE).<br>The presenter notification deadline remains the same: April 20, 2015.<br><br>UPDATES:<br>The DEBS 2015 Poster and Demo Track is accepting submissions now.<br>The deadline for Poster and Demo submissions is April 30th, 2015 (AoE).<br>For more details check http://www.debs2015.org/call-posters.html [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T18:34:23+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Vinay Setty</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;8944f66b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;70050697.1503">   <title>[research-ds-euro] SSIV 2015 - deadline approaching </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;70050697.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>This is a reminder that the International Workshop on Safety and<br>Security of Intelligent Vehicles (SSIV) is approaching: 8/March.<br><br>Besides being co-located with DSN, the most prestigious conference on<br>dependable computing and security, this workshop is being supported by<br>members of the IEEE Intelligent Transportation Systems Society,<br>therefore we envision an exciting debate between distinguished<br>researchers and practitioners from different communities. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T17:16:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Antonio Casimiro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;70050697.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;11471368.1503">   <title>[research-ds-euro] Workshops CFPapers DSN 2015, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;11471368.1503</link>   <description> [apologies for the multiple copies - see this message as a kind reminder<br>- DEADLINE APPROACHING]<br><br>DSN 2015 Workshops - Call for Papers<br><br>The 45th Annual IEEE/IFIP International Conference on<br>Dependable Systems and Networks (DSN 2015)<br><br>22-25 June 2015<br>Rio de Janeiro, Brazil<br><br>Twitter: @DSN2015Rio<br><br>Submission deadline: 8 March 2015<br>Author notification: 15 April 2015<br>Workshops: 22 June 2015<br><br>* Dependability Issues in SDN and NFV (DISN)<br>http://www.inf.ufpr.br/disn/<br>This workshop will discuss and present solutions to the dependability<br>and security issues related to SND (Software Defined Networks) and NFV<br>(Network Function Virtualization). These issues include: fault<br>characterization and monitoring, novel [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T09:49:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rogerio de Lemos</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;11471368.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;96ae0159.1503">   <title>[fm-announcements] CFP: 11th International Workshop on Developments in Computational Models </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;96ae0159.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;96ae0159.1503">[fm-announcements] CFP: 11th International Workshop on Developments in Computational Models </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T19:18:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MUNOZ, CESAR (LARC-D320)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;96ae0159.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;b6f79882.1503">   <title>[CSPlus] Joint Call For Papers - With the intense competition that has ensued in this industry, games are now rapidly incorporating sophisticated technologies, which include the recent advances in wearable head-mounted displays, cloud computing, virtual reality and augmented reality adapting them [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-01T17:42:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Eduardo Cuervo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;150a0cc3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;57302ed4.1503">   <title>CFP IEEE Sensors Journal: Special issue on Advances in Underwater Acoustic Sensor Networks </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;57302ed4.1503</link>   <description> IEEE Sensors Council<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>IEEE Sensors Journal Special issue on<br>Advances in Underwater Acoustic Sensor Networks<br><br>Underpinned by technological advances, there is a growing interest in the design, development, and deployment of Underwater Acoustic Sensor Networks (UASNs) for marine applications. Most of these applications require research in novel theoretical models or evaluation methodologies leading to practical distributed and centralized algorithms. Sustained effort in the recent years has resulted in applications now routinely adopted in UASNs, but there are still many problems awaiting a solution. Some examples of unresolved issues are managing the fouling and corrosion of electronics devices, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-01T02:26:24+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jaime Lloret Mauri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CABERNET-EVENTS;57302ed4.1503</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
